page.title: 10CRYMLIN BOG
page.content: Crymlin bog is a site of special scientific interest.It occupies what was an inlet of the sea.In medieval times storms blocked the inlet and since then marsh plants have covered it giving 5 metres thickness of peat. The whole area is waterlogged giving a large reed swamp.Plants found include bog pimpernel and marsh forget me not.The bog also provides a home for rare birds including Bearded Reedlings,Water Rail & Hen Harriers. It is regarded as one of the most important ornithological sites in South Wales.Many rare insects and other invertebrates are also found including the Emperor Dragon Fly and rare Crane flies.Crymlin bog is even more remarkable for the fact that it is between the M4 and B.P. Llandarcy. B.P. help conserve the bog,but a threat exists from rubbish dumping.
